metadata.title: CVE-2015-3239 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Off-by-one error in the dwarf_to_unw_regnum function in include/dwarf_i.h in libunwind 1.1 allows local users to have unspecified impact via invalid dwarf opcodes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2015-3239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

android-libunwind - 8.1.0+r23-2
No subscription required

libunwind-setjmp0 - 1.1-4.1
libunwind8 - 1.1-4.1
No subscription required

notes.note: seth-arnold> I saw nothing in callers of this macro that would prevent less-than-zero accesses: input params were sometimes integers, sometimes harder to determine the type. Debian codesearch shows many duplications of the <= mistake with dwarf_to_unw_regnum arrays in other files, not just the one dwarf_i.h.

criterions.comment: android-platform-external-libunwind package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0+r23-2').
libunwind package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1-4.1').
racket package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
